searchDocs.title: version​
searchDocs.content: </> Config.version: number  TIP It's can be used as a number for comparing version and then apply to item / entity schema or data-transformation.

searchDocs.title: fingerprint​
searchDocs.content: </> Config.fingerprint: string  TIP It's can be represent as a machine-id, place-id, job-id, etc. for better randomness. But it depends on your entropy factory function too.

searchDocs.title: clock​
searchDocs.content: </> Config.clock() → number-- A unix-timestamp in milliseconds as a integer. A factory function for produce unix-timestamp in milliseconds as a integer. TIP You can overwrite this, and implement your own clock function.

searchDocs.title: entropy​
searchDocs.content: </> Config.entropy( version: number, timestamp: number, fingerprint: string, counter: number ) → number-- A random number between [0, 1] A factory function for produce random number between [0, 1] TIP You can overwrite this, and implement your own entropy function.

searchDocs.title: next​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid.next( version: number?, timestamp: number? ) → string-- quid Generate a new quid with global config state

searchDocs.title: parse​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid.parse(quid: string) → ( number,-- version number,-- timestamp number-- uniqueness ) Parse a quid string into its components

searchDocs.title: is​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid.is(x: any | string?) → boolean Check if x is a valid quid

searchDocs.title: update​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid.update( quid: string, target_version: number?-- If nil: increment +1 (Can be decrease or increase) ) → ( string,-- Updated quid number?-- Target version (If nil: not updated) ) Apply a version to the global config

searchDocs.title: Errors
searchDocs.content: Type	Description"Invalid quid"	quid is a base64url string and must be 28 characters

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid.new(config: Config?) → Quid<Config>-- Quid object Create a new quid object with custom config state

searchDocs.title: Next​
searchDocs.content: </> Quid:Next( version: number?, timestamp: number? ) → string-- quid Generate a new quid with local config state

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: Add Quid to your wally.toml:  Quid = "6531503070/quid@1.0.0"   tip If you're new to Wally, check out the Wally installation guide.

searchDocs.title: Basic Setup​
searchDocs.content: Here's how to set up Quid with a simple data structure:  local Quid = require(path.to.quid) local uid = Quid.next()

searchDocs.title: Features​
searchDocs.content: Version-detectable: The uid can be represent version of item / entity data schemaK-Sortable: The uid can be K-sortable as it is time-basedRandom-Customizable: The random specification can be customized, by providing a configHuman-Friendly: Human-friendly writing and reading, as it is represent as base64url
